story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: extreme_experience
primary_trope.hook_text: Only a handful of races score 5/5 on Experience. Paris to Ancaster is one.
primary_trope.mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) — knowing a perfect score exists but not why triggers dopamine anticipation.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Paris to Ancaster? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Paris to Ancaster scored 70 out of 100. Elite tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Paris to Ancaster?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Paris to Ancaster. Paris to Ancaster, Ontario, Canada. 62 mi. A multi-surface chaos ride through Ontario farmland. Fast flat rail trail sections contrast with hike-a-bike mud chutes. The racing is European spring classic style. surge for position before the bottleneck sectors, survive the mud, then sprint for the final climb. Point-to-point from Paris to Ancaster.
beats.text_on_screen: Paris to Ancaster | Paris to Ancaster, Ontario, Canada | 62 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Experience. 5 out of 5. Once-in-a-lifetime course experience. The mud creates lasting memories. Technicality. 4 out of 5. Rocky, rooty, or both. Probably both. Matt Surch describes the farm field sector: 'Picture a furrowed farm field, 4' deep trenches cut into the soil. Climate. 4 out of 5. Conditions will test your kit choices. Late April in Ontario guarantees suffering — 5°C to 12°C, overcast, and mud regardless of race-day conditions thanks to spring thaw. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Serious exploration vibes. Far from pavement. Kyra witnessed the chaos of bottlenecks: 'There was a huge downed tree on the single track. Prestige. 4 out of 5. Top-shelf reputation. Calendar priority. Canada's largest gravel race since 1994, now a UCI Gravel World Series qualifier. Race Quality. 4 out of 5. High-quality event. Attention to detail shows. Peter Glassford emphasizes preparation thoroughness: 'Set up your race bike as if the race was this weekend and use all your gear, fueling, preparation. Community. 4 out of 5. The post-race scene is half the event. Canada's largest gravel field with over 2,000 riders. Field Depth. 4 out of 5. Pro-level talent in the mix. UCI qualifier status draws competitive talent.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Value. 4 out of 5. Good value. More bang for your buck than most. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Gets the job done. Nothing fancy. Elevation. 3 out of 5. The hills sort the trained from the untrained. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. Length. 2 out of 5. Short but honest about it. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: What Paris to Ancaster does well.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

strengths: Canada's largest gravel race with 30-year history
UCI World Series qualifier adds legitimacy

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.narration: What they don't put on the website.
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

weaknesses: Weather is a massive variable—can be miserable

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.

broll_sources.query: Paris to Ancaster, Ontario, Canada travel guide

beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: YYZ - 1hr to Hamilton area; YHM - 20min
Lodging: Stay in Ancaster or Hamilton. Most park at finish and take shuttle to Paris start. Book early. 2.5 thousand+ riders fill hotels.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Spring Chaos. Yes if you want Canada's flagship gravel event and can handle mud chaos. Yes if you like spring classics vibes. Skip if you hate cold/wet or can't accept potential mechanical disaster.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Paris to Ancaster isn't quite right for you. Barry-Roubaix; Dirty Reiver; Mid South
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Paris to Ancaster? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic pose, 'Paris to Ancaster' bold text, tier badge 'ELITE', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
